attributes.action: reverse the decision to close thousands of Post Offices.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Post Offices fulfil a very important role in society, often acting as an economic and social lifeline to many elderly, poor or vulnerable people.
They may well make a financial loss but their value in terms of community cohesion is without price.
With rural and local bus services under threat or withdrawn, many of the Post Offices' most vulnerable customers will experience serious hardship in going about their daily business as small Post Office's often support other vital local services.
Surely £150 million out of a Government of £500 billion is a tiny price to pay for a vital community lifeline?
Please reverse the decision to close thousands of Post Office's. Thank you.
